Crescent Beach Fishing (904) 910-8906 Share This Crescent Beach Fishing is a fishing charter provided by Captain Kenny Romero on his 2017 Key West 230 Bay Reef powered by a Yamaha 250 SHO 4 stroke. He offers inshore and offshore fishing, as well as tours on the water and dolphin-watching excursions. Captain Kenny does a lot of the work for you, providing gear, bait, tackle, and fishing licenses, so that all you have to worry about bringing are drinks, snacks (alcohol is allowed but no hard liquor or glass bottles), sunscreen (no spray sunscreen), hat, sunglasses, and a cooler to transport your catch home (which you can leave in your car). Children of any age are welcome and Captain Kenny can even teach young anglers how to fish. He'll talk with you beforehand to sort out a day and time for the fishing charter based on the season, tides, and weather. The boat takes a maximum of four people. Prices are based on two passengers with an added $25 per additional person. Cash or credit payment is permitted, there is a 3% surcharge on credit cards. Featured Communities Neighborhoods Regions Guide Apartments Homes Construction Contractors Government Services Healthcare Home Services Lenders Places of Worship Real Estate Services Schools Utilities Search St. Augustine Municipal Marina Hosting a dock and mooring space, on-shore facilities, dinghy docks, and a special event lawn. St. Augustine Municipal Marina (904) 825-1026 Next to the Bridge of Lions. 111 Avenida Menendez St. Augustine, FL 32084 The Marina is Open 24/7 for boat traffic. View Google Map Share This Show all As the nation's oldest city and first seaport, St. Augustine has been connected to the sea for more than 450 years. The St. Augustine Municipal Marina is located in the heart of the historic district, with most of the attractions and historic sites within easy walking distance. The marina offers 96 slips for vessels up to 200 feet and 100 moorings. The marina's helpful staff is on duty 24/7, 365 days a year, and provides all necessary facilities for both sail and power boats. Public restrooms are available here, and fuel, oil, and ice are available at the fuel dock. There are additional facilities for boating guests, including showers and a laundry room with washers and dryers. The marina monitors Channel 71. Several popular water tours depart from the marina, including the Black Raven Pirate cruises , the Scenic Cruise , the Schooner Freedom tall ship, and St. Augustine Eco Tours . When it's in port, the replica Spanish galleon El Galeón will dock here as well. During St. Augustine Race Week in the spring, most of the visiting race boats will be on the dock for casual viewing when they are not racing. Events and ceremonies may be held on the Municipal Marina's lawn area. Public restrooms, electric power, and potable water are available on site for events. The Municipal Marina can assist with obtaining catering, tents, tables, and chairs for events. Call (904) 825-1026 for more information about private event usage. For wedding information, call (904) 826-0166.  Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises. Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remains true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation. Property info Experience Crescent/St. Augustine Beach the way the locals do at Crescent Beach Bungalow, where you'll be just a few minutes' walk from the beach ramp and less than 100 steps from the Intercoastal Waterway. There are great fishing platforms under the drawbridge and the sunset each evening is truly a sight to see!

This home is one of two separate cottages on the property. This listing is for the smaller house, which has recently been upgraded to include its own washer/dryer. Inside, find old-time charm, comfortable furnishings, and a kitchenette with a two-burner cooktop, a refrigerator, and a microwave.

The yard is fenced for your dogs, and there's parking right in front of the bungalow (trailers and boats are welcome too!).

Crescent Beach is only 11 miles south of downtown St. Augustine and 45 miles north of Daytona Beach. It offers miles and miles of white sand beach for you to walk or ride your bike on, and the surf fishing is fantastic. Walk with a cup of coffee in the morning and see the sunrise, or head out with a flashlight at night to spot the ghost crabs scrambling on the sand. You'll also be close enough to walk to local restaurants and even a fun Irish pub.

THINGS TO KNOW
This home can be rented together with the other bungalow on the property, Crescent Beach Cottage.
There is a kitchenette with a two-burner cooktop, a microwave, and a refrigerator.

Please note: this home resides in a noise-sensitive area and the owners participate in our Good Neighbor protection program. Our smart home technology will alert our team if excessive decibel or occupancy levels are detected, allowing us to reach out directly with a reminder of maximun occupancy and quiet hours. This technology is privacy compliant, and only monitors the presence of decibels and devices -not any personal conversation or information. Thank you for supporting our efforts to be good neighbors!

Crescent Beach owner Katherine Mott faces uncertain future amid scandal News Sports Life Business Data Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals NEWS Crescent Beach owner's business empire faces uncertain future amid financial scandal Gary Craig Rochester Democrat and Chronicle While Katherine Mott's businesses continue to operate amid allegations of a massive check-kiting scheme, her long-term ownership future for her catering and restaurant operations is beginning to look bleak. A court-appointed receiver warns in a report that because of "structural and systemic operational deficiencies, additional non-business and even business assets must be sold." Steps are already underway to sell the shuttered Crescent Beach lakefront restaurant in Greece, which Mott bought but was unable to open. As well, Mott is moving to sell Monroe's Restaurant in Pittsford and the Divinity Estate and Chapel wedding and events operation, the report states. Mott has been a leading restaurateur and events planner locally but, records show, fell onto tougher times as she added more operations. An attorney for Mott declined to comment. The receiver warnings The receiver, Mark Kercher, was appointed in April and has reported that the businesses have stayed afloat and operated largely normally. However, the long-term financial prognostication is steadily turning dire, the report shows. Because of existing debt and other expenses, the money for survival and stability likely will be dependent on sales of the businesses, the report states. Mott's businesses "are not structurally capable of meeting these ordinary-course obligations," Kercher wrote. Kercher does not warn that there should be fears from people who have booked events. In fact, the cash flow from the operations is what has allowed them to continue largely without hiccups in operations and will do so in the near future. Check kiting allegations In a lawsuit filed this year, Five Star Community Bank accused Mott and a business partner of check kiting. With the alleged fraud, Five Star contended, the businesses opened multiple accounts then rapidly shifted money between the accounts. This allowed payments of nearly $19 million that was not covered by money because of the time that could lapse after a deposit and before the bank saw the money was unavailable, Five Star alleges. That prompted another bank, Community Bank, to transfer money from Mott's accounts to Five Star. Mott has sued Community Bank , alleging that its transfer of $593,000 was improper and she should have use of the money. Five Star officials declined to comment about the latest report from the receiver. — Gary Craig is a veteran reporter with the Democrat and Chronicle, covering courts and crime and more. You can reach Craig at gcraig@rocheste.gannett.com . He is the author of two books, including "Seven Million: A Cop, a Priest, a Soldier for the IRA, and the Still-Unsolved Rochester Brink's Heist. Select Saturdays | 1:00 p.m. SurfQuest Beach Days (904) 824-7249 Mary St. Boat Ramp in Crescent Beach Mary Street Crescent Beach, FL 32080 View Google Map Share This +1 more The Arc of St. Johns offers a free monthly beach day on select Saturdays at the Mary Street boat ramp in Crescent Beach for anyone with a disability. SurfQuest's dedicated volunteers provide surfing lessons and water recreation programs at these monthly gatherings, helping families access the beach and ocean without barriers. SurfQuest also advocates for beach accessibility for those with limited mobility, providing adaptive equipment and training. The Arc of the St. Johns extends SurfQuest's mission to all disabilities, including veterans. Get more information or learn about volunteering. Email questions about this event to The Arc of The St. Johns. Admission: Free When: At 1:00 p.m. on: May 10, 2025 June 28, 2025 July 19, 2025 Aug. 16, 2025 Sept. 20, 2025 Where: Crescent Beach boat ramp, Mary Street, St. Augustine, 32080 About the Arc of the St. Johns: The Arc of the St. Johns provides the opportunity for hope, growth, and change to people with intellectual or developmental disabilities in the St. Augustine community. Crescent Beach (904) 209-0752 A1A just south of St. Augustine Beach. 6930 A1A S. Crescent Beach, FL 32080 View Google Map Share This Show all Crescent Beach is a beautiful stretch of the Florida coast just south of St. Augustine. It gets its name from the natural shape of the coastline. The hard-packed sand lends itself to activities including beach bike rides, walks, frisbee, and volleyball. Visitors can enjoy relaxing on the beach or participating in a variety of water sports like surfing, swimming, and boogie boarding, as well as boating from the marked public access points on A1A. Crescent Beach is a small community with little commercial development. There are plenty of beach house rentals , condos, and cottages available here. Wooden decks and flyovers provide safe access to the beach across the protected sand dunes. Beach Access and Facilities Minimal vehicle beach access is offered at the Crescent Beach Ramp on Cubbedge Road. A nominal access fee for driving on the beach is charged daily from March 1 through August 31, and then only on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday through September. Visit here for more information. Rules for driving on the beach are posted and are strictly enforced for safety reasons. From May 1 through September 30 driving on the beach is allowed only from 8:00 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. From October 1 through April 30, driving on the beach is allowed only from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m Horseback riding is allowed during designated times only with a special permit. More information is available here . This map shows all beach access points in St. Johns County and will note the walkover points and footbridges that are currently closed.
